intro: Hieracium alipedatum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a single head, often surrounded by bracts. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
